author: cmpilato
msg: Prior to this change, merges performed on a single file failed to
honor the --ignore-ancestry flag, opting instead to always ignore
ancestry.  This caused unexpected behavior when merging single-file
(merge_file_added): Be a little more forgiving when calculation
(do_single_file_merge): Add 'ignore_ancestry' parameter, and use it to
determine whether not a merge across unrelated file nodes should
be treated as a file modification or a delete+add.  While here,
actually grow support for the delete+add case.

author: dlr
msg: Be more explicit about the definition of revision blocking.

author: cmpilato
msg: Fix the regression test for issue #2853 (do_single_file_merge() lacks
use peg revision syntax -- the jury is still out (for me) on
whether or not that use-case is expected to fail.

author: dlr
msg: Note that "Commutative Author and Revision Reporting" is partially
implemented (for 'log -g').  Suggest an alternate behavior pattern

author: hwright
msg: Add the include_merged_revisions parameter for get_file_revs() to the dav
from dav requests, and pass it along to the repos.
